H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H4694.def: = construction or set of constructions in the shape of walls, ramparts, and towers; ► erected in order to make a town better defendable against attack or siege

H6822.def: = action by which humans or deities watch attentitvely to monitor people and places

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H4975.def: = the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

H553.def: = state in which humans have political and/or military strength

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

91.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1347.def: = dense growth of shrubbery or small trees, habitat of animals

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H1238.def: = to act forcibly on something, ► so as to cause it to become waste and/or desolate

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H2156.def: = part of a {L:vine<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>} which grows out of the trunk or a bough

H4043.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H119.def: = state in which an object is red or reddish in color; ≈ often associated with beauty

H6393.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = hard and shining metal; ◄ alloy of iron and carbon; ► used for making tools and weapons{N:001}

H7393.def: = upper stone of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H1265.def: exact meaning unsure: = one of the evergreen trees commonly found in the Lebanon, with round leaves rather than flat; its fruit is a a mostly inedible seed-bearing, fleshy cone; ≈ regarded as one of the glorious trees of the Lebanon

H7393.def: = upper stone of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H8264.def: = process by which animals move forward at great speed and with aggressive intent

H7339.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H4758.def: = the part of an object that can be seen with the eye

H3940.def: = piece of wood burning on one end; ► used to provide light or as a means of igniting something else; ≈ associated with light and destruction

H7323.def: = action by which humans walk at a relatively high speed

H1300.def: = process by which bright flashes of light are seen between clouds and the ground or within clouds, often accompanied by thunder; ≈ regarded as fire from heaven and arrows or spears from God

H117.def: = pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H1979.def: = action by which humans move forward, usually towards a specific destination

H4116.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H2346.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H1964.def: = a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political

H4127.def: = process by which a relatively hard object becomes softer

H5324.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals place themselves in a certain location in an upright position

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H519.def: = woman who is the legal property of someone else; either married or eligible for marriage; her children belong to the person who owns her; ≈ because of this an  אָמָה  appears to have a somewhat higher status than a  שִׁפְחָה  even though both terms are sometimes used interchangeably

H5090.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to journey from one place to the other, whether with force or not

H3123.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H5210.def: = town; ◄ located in northern Mesopotamia near Mosul on the east bank of the {L:Tigris<SDBH:חִדֶּקֶל>}; ► built by {L:Nimrod<SDBH:נִמְרֹד>} after the {L:flood<SDBH:מַבּוּל>}; ancient capital of {L:Assyria<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}, preached against by the prophet {L:Jonah<SDBH:יֹונָה>}

H1295.def: = relatively large reservoir ◄ dug by human hands ► to collect water; place where many public activities take place

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H962.def: = action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H950.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = state of total desolation as a result of destruction

H4003.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = state of total desolation as a result of destruction

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H4549.def: = process by which substances become soft, ◄ often as a result of  a higher temperature

H1290.def: = central area of the leg where the thigh is joined to the lower leg; ≈ associated with stability and strength

H6375.def: = state of moving unsteadily from side to side

H4975.def: = the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

H2479.def: = state of strong fear and distress, compared to the state of mind of a woman in labor; ► often accompanied by physical side-effects, like writhing and trembling

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H6289.def: = reddish glow on one's face; ≈ associated with health and well-being

H346.def: = a reference to an unknown location; normally used with the purpose of finding out which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H4583.def: = a location that deities, humans or animals have made their dwelling place; ≈ associated with security

H4829.def: = open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2729.def: = state/process by which inanimate objects shake or tremble violently

H2963.def: = action by which a person or animal is cut up and killed with one's claws and/or teeth ► for food or in order to enlarge one's territory; ≈ associated with terrifying and deadly viciousness

H1767.def: = state of being sufficient in quantity for a given purpose

glosses: to strangle oneself (with a rope around the neck)
H2614.def: = action by which humans kill themselves ◄ by cutting their air supply

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H2356.def: = empty, open place ◄ in a solid body

H2964.def: literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare

H4585.def: = a location that deities, humans or animals have made their dwelling place; ≈ associated with security

H2966.def: literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H1197.def: = process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

H7393.def: = upper stone of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H2964.def: literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
